results.title: This is Farnborough
results.creator_credit: British Movietone News and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A record of the 20th Flying Display and Exhibition, 1959, at Farnborough of the Society of British Aircraft Constructors. Spectacular group flying by Royal Navy Scimitars and RAF Hunters; Britain’s principle guided missiles; the Short SC1 research aircraft; the Fairey Rotodyne; various helicopter designs; the Saunders-Rose Hovercraft.

results.title: This is China
results.brief_description: A brief sketch of China’s long struggle for freedom, throughout which the Chinese people have shown an ability to survive what would seem overwhelming calamities. The primitive life of the peasantry is shown, but it is pointed out that newer methods of agriculture, and a fairer distribution of land, is gradually superseding the old way of life, even in the most remote areas. It is said that the China of tomorrow will combine the culture of the east with industrial developments of the west.

results.title: This is automation
results.creator_credit: Raphael G. Wolff Studios and Frank Boynton
results.brief_description: Defines automation and illustrates industrial applications of the principles of automation. Points out that automation can be applied to many different phases of manufacturing and a plant does not have to be fully automated to take advantage of present development. Automatic equipment is seen in operation in an electric bulb assembly plant, a pretzel factory, an automobile manufacturing plant. Mentions advantages of automation - increased efficiency, conservation of man-power, increased safety, improved quality.

results.title: This is an emergency
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jeffrey Schon, Derek Lamb and Terence Macartney-Filgate
results.brief_description: Leading Canadian scientist David Suzuki examines the background to Canada’s reliance on oil and offers somce solutions to the problems posed by its growing scarcity. Industry and citizens must look for ways to conserve energy in order to lower the escalating cost of operating factories, heating homes and transporting people and goods. “This Is an Emergency” looks at some of the methods used in Sweden and gives practical solutions to the much talked about energy crisis. In an entertaining way, the film delivers important information about controlling energy costs that affect the price of goods we buy. Uses some animation and still photography.

results.title: This is Alice Springs
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film, Television and Laboratories and Ted Wilson
results.brief_description: Alice Springs, the outback centre of Australia as seen by tourists. The main street with modern buildings and shops, up-to-date hotels, air mail delivery by chartered plane, new schools, contemporary homes. The beautiful church dedicated to the memory of John Flynn, “Flynn of the Inland”, who founded the Australian Inland Mission and the Flying Doctor Service. The surrounding country, Stanley Chasm, Uluru, and the airport which keeps it in touch with the rest of Australia.
